fields.info: Primary key. Type of action of the drug e.g., agonist, antagonist
fields.name: action_type (PK)

fields.info: Description of how the action type is used
fields.name: description

fields.info: Higher-level grouping of action types e.g., positive vs negative action
fields.name: parent_type

fields.info: Unique ID for the activity row
fields.name: activity_id (PK)

fields.info: Foreign key to the assays table (containing the assay description)
fields.name: assay

fields.info: Foreign key to documents table (for quick lookup of publication details - can also link to documents through compound_records or assays table)
fields.name: doc

fields.info: Foreign key to the compound_records table (containing information on the compound tested)
fields.name: record

fields.info: Foreign key to compounds table (for quick lookup of compound structure - can also link to compounds through compound_records table)
fields.name: molregno

fields.info: Symbol constraining the activity value (e.g. >, <, =)
fields.name: standard_relation

fields.info: Datapoint value as it appears in the original publication.
fields.name: published_value

fields.info: Units of measurement as they appear in the original publication
fields.name: published_units

fields.info: Same as PUBLISHED_VALUE but transformed to common units: e.g. mM concentrations converted to nM.
fields.name: standard_value

fields.info: Selected 'Standard' units for data type: e.g. concentrations are in nM.
fields.name: standard_units

fields.info: Shows whether the standardised columns have been curated/set (1) or just default to the published data (0).
fields.name: standard_flag

fields.info: Standardised version of the published_activity_type (e.g. IC50 rather than Ic-50/Ic50/ic50/ic-50)
fields.name: standard_type

fields.info: Describes non-numeric activities i.e. 'Slighty active', 'Not determined'
fields.name: activity_comment

fields.info: Type of end-point measurement: e.g. IC50, LD50, %inhibition etc, as it appears in the original publication
fields.name: published_type

fields.info: Comment reflecting whether the values for this activity measurement are likely to be correct - one of 'Manually validated' (checked original paper and value is correct), 'Potential author error' (value looks incorrect but is as reported in the original paper), 'Outside typical range' (value seems too high/low to be correct e.g., negative IC50 value), 'Non standard unit type' (units look incorrect for this activity type).
fields.name: data_validity_comment

fields.info: Indicates whether the value is likely to be a repeat citation of a value reported in a previous ChEMBL paper, rather than a new, independent measurement.
fields.name: potential_duplicate

fields.info: Symbol constraining the activity value (e.g. >, <, =), as it appears in the original publication
fields.name: published_relation

fields.info: Negative log of selected concentration-response activity values (IC50/EC50/XC50/AC50/Ki/Kd/Potency)
fields.name: pchembl_value

fields.info: ID for the corresponding result type in BioAssay Ontology (based on standard_type)
fields.name: bao_endpoint

fields.info: ID for the corresponding unit in Unit Ontology (based on standard_units)
fields.name: uo_units

fields.info: ID for the corresponding unit in QUDT Ontology (based on standard_units)
fields.name: qudt_units

fields.info: Primary key.
fields.name: std_act_id (PK)

fields.info: The standard_type that other published_types in the activities table have been converted to.
fields.name: standard_type

fields.info: A description/definition of the standard_type.
fields.name: definition

fields.info: The units that are applied to this standard_type and to which other published_units are converted. Note a standard_type may have more than one allowable standard_unit and therefore multiple rows in this table.
fields.name: standard_units

fields.info: The lowest value for this activity type that is likely to be genuine. This is only an approximation, so lower genuine values may exist, but it may be desirable to validate these before using them. For a given standard_type/units, values in the activities table below this threshold are flagged with a data_validity_comment of 'Outside typical range'.
fields.name: normal_range_min

fields.info: The highest value for this activity type that is likely to be genuine. This is only an approximation, so higher genuine values may exist, but it may be desirable to validate these before using them. For a given standard_type/units, values in the activities table above this threshold are flagged with a data_validity_comment of 'Outside typical range'.
fields.name: normal_range_max

fields.info: Numeric primary key
fields.name: assay_param_id (PK)

fields.info: Foreign key to assays table. The assay to which this parameter belongs
fields.name: assay

fields.info: Foreign key to parameter_type table, defining the meaning of the parameter
fields.name: parameter_type

fields.info: The value of the particular parameter
fields.name: parameter_value

fields.info: Single character representing assay type
fields.name: assay_type (PK)

fields.info: Description of assay type
fields.name: assay_desc

fields.info: Unique ID for the assay
fields.name: assay_id (PK)

fields.info: Foreign key to documents table
fields.name: doc

fields.info: Description of the reported assay
fields.name: description

fields.info: Assay classification, e.g. B=Binding assay, A=ADME assay, F=Functional assay
fields.name: assay_type

fields.info: Type of assay system (i.e., in vivo or in vitro)
fields.name: assay_test_type

fields.info: screening, confirmatory (ie: dose-response), summary, panel or other.
fields.name: assay_category

fields.info: Name of the organism for the assay system (e.g., the organism, tissue or cell line in which an assay was performed). May differ from the target organism (e.g., for a human protein expressed in non-human cells, or pathogen-infected human cells).
fields.name: assay_organism

fields.info: NCBI tax ID for the assay organism.
fields.name: assay_tax_id

fields.info: Name of specific strain of the assay organism used (where known)
fields.name: assay_strain

fields.info: Name of tissue used in the assay system (e.g., for tissue-based assays) or from which the assay system was derived (e.g., for cell/subcellular fraction-based assays).
fields.name: assay_tissue

fields.info: Name of cell type or cell line used in the assay system (e.g., for cell-based assays).
fields.name: assay_cell_type

fields.info: Name of subcellular fraction used in the assay system (e.g., microsomes, mitochondria).
fields.name: assay_subcellular_fraction

fields.info: Target identifier to which this assay has been mapped. Foreign key to target_dictionary. From ChEMBL_15 onwards, an assay will have only a single target assigned.
fields.name: tid

fields.info: Flag indicating of the relationship between the reported target in the source document and the assigned target from TARGET_DICTIONARY. Foreign key to RELATIONSHIP_TYPE table.
fields.name: relationship_type

fields.info: Confidence score, indicating how accurately the assigned target(s) represents the actually assay target. Foreign key to CONFIDENCE_SCORE table. 0 means uncurated/unassigned, 1 = low confidence to 9 = high confidence.
fields.name: confidence_score

fields.info: Indicates the level of curation of the target assignment. Foreign key to curation_lookup table.
fields.name: curated_by

fields.info: Foreign key to source table
fields.name: src

fields.info: Identifier for the assay in the source database/deposition (e.g., pubchem AID)
fields.name: src_assay_id

fields.info: ChEMBL identifier for this assay (for use on web interface etc)
fields.name: chembl

fields.info: Foreign key to cell dictionary. The cell type or cell line used in the assay
fields.name: cell

fields.info: ID for the corresponding format type in BioAssay Ontology (e.g., cell-based, biochemical, organism-based etc)
fields.name: bao_format

fields.info: WHO/INN name for the compound
fields.name: who_name

fields.info: First level of classification
fields.name: level1

fields.info: Second level of classification
fields.name: level2

fields.info: Third level of classification
fields.name: level3

fields.info: Fourth level of classification
fields.name: level4

fields.info: Complete ATC code for compound
fields.name: level5 (PK)

fields.info: WHO Identifier for compound
fields.name: who_id

fields.info: Description of first level of classification
fields.name: level1_description

fields.info: Description of second level of classification
fields.name: level2_description

fields.info: Description of third level of classification
fields.name: level3_description

fields.info: Description of fourth level of classification
fields.name: level4_description

fields.info: Primary key. Unique identifier for a binding site in a given target.
fields.name: site_id (PK)

fields.info: Name/label for the binding site.
fields.name: site_name

fields.info: Foreign key to target_dictionary. Target on which the binding site is found.
fields.name: tid

fields.info: Primary key. Unique identifier for each of the molecular components of biotherapeutics in ChEMBL (e.g., antibody chains, recombinant proteins, synthetic peptides).
fields.name: component_id (PK)

fields.info: Type of molecular component (e.g., 'PROTEIN','DNA','RNA').
fields.name: component_type

fields.info: Description/name of molecular component.
fields.name: description

fields.info: Sequence of the biotherapeutic component.
fields.name: sequence

fields.info: MD5 checksum of the sequence.
fields.name: sequence_md5sum

fields.info: NCBI tax ID for the species from which the sequence is derived. May be null for humanized monoclonal antibodies, synthetic peptides etc.
fields.name: tax_id

fields.info: Name of the species from which the sequence is derived.
fields.name: organism

fields.info: Primary key.
fields.name: biocomp_id (PK)

fields.info: Foreign key to the biotherapeutics table, indicating which biotherapeutic the component is part of.
fields.name: molregno

fields.info: Foreign key to the bio_component_sequences table, indicating which component is part of the biotherapeutic.
fields.name: component

fields.info: Foreign key to molecule_dictionary
fields.name: molregno (PK)

fields.info: Description of the biotherapeutic.
fields.name: description

fields.info: Sequence notation generated according to the HELM standard (http://www.openhelm.org/home). Currently for peptides only
fields.name: helm_notation

fields.info: Primary key. Unique identifier for each cell line in the target_dictionary.
fields.name: cell_id (PK)

fields.info: Name of each cell line (as used in the target_dicitonary pref_name).
fields.name: cell_name

fields.info: Longer description (where available) of the cell line.
fields.name: cell_description

fields.info: Tissue from which the cell line is derived, where known.
fields.name: cell_source_tissue

fields.info: Name of organism from which the cell line is derived.
fields.name: cell_source_organism

fields.info: NCBI tax ID of the organism from which the cell line is derived.
fields.name: cell_source_tax_id

fields.info: ID for the corresponding cell line in Cell Line Ontology
fields.name: clo_id

fields.info: ID for the corresponding cell line in Experimental Factory Ontology
fields.name: efo_id

fields.info: ID for the corresponding cell line in Cellosaurus Ontology
fields.name: cellosaurus_id

fields.info: Cell ID used in LINCS (Library of Integrated Network-based Cellular Signatures)
fields.name: cl_lincs_id

fields.info: ChEMBL identifier for the cell (used in web interface etc)
fields.name: chembl

fields.info: ChEMBL identifier
fields.name: chembl_id (PK)

fields.info: Type of entity (e.g., COMPOUND, ASSAY, TARGET)
fields.name: entity_type

fields.info: Primary key for that entity in corresponding table (e.g., molregno for compounds, tid for targets)
fields.name: entity_id

fields.info: Indicates whether the status of the entity within the database - ACTIVE, INACTIVE (downgraded), OBS (obsolete/removed).
fields.name: status

fields.info: Foreign key to component_sequences table.
fields.name: component

fields.info: Foreign key to the protein_classification table.
fields.name: protein_class

fields.info: Primary key.
fields.name: comp_class_id (PK)

fields.info: Primary key.
fields.name: compd_id (PK)

fields.info: Foreign key to the domains table, indicating the domain that is contained in the associated molecular component.
fields.name: domain

fields.info: Foreign key to the component_sequences table, indicating the molecular_component that has the given domain.
fields.name: component

fields.info: Start position of the domain within the sequence given in the component_sequences table.
fields.name: start_position

fields.info: End position of the domain within the sequence given in the component_sequences table.
fields.name: end_position

fields.info: Primary key. Unique identifier for the component.
fields.name: component_id (PK)

fields.info: Type of molecular component represented (e.g., 'PROTEIN','DNA','RNA').
fields.name: component_type

fields.info: Accession for the sequence in the source database from which it was taken (e.g., UniProt accession for proteins).
fields.name: accession

fields.info: A representative sequence for the molecular component, as given in the source sequence database (not necessarily the exact sequence used in the assay).
fields.name: sequence

fields.info: MD5 checksum of the sequence.
fields.name: sequence_md5sum

fields.info: Description/name for the molecular component, usually taken from the source sequence database.
fields.name: description

fields.info: NCBI tax ID for the sequence in the source database (i.e., species that the protein/nucleic acid sequence comes from).
fields.name: tax_id

fields.info: Name of the organism the sequence comes from.
fields.name: organism

fields.info: The name of the source sequence database from which sequences/accessions are taken. For UniProt proteins, this field indicates whether the sequence is from SWISS-PROT or TREMBL.
fields.name: db_source

fields.info: The version of the source sequence database from which sequences/accession were last updated.
fields.name: db_version

fields.info: Primary key.
fields.name: compsyn_id (PK)

fields.info: Foreign key to the component_sequences table. The component to which this synonym applies.
fields.name: component

fields.info: The synonym for the component.
fields.name: component_synonym

fields.info: The type or origin of the synonym (e.g., GENE_SYMBOL).
fields.name: syn_type

fields.info: Foreign key to compounds table (compound structure)
fields.name: molregno (PK)

fields.info: Molecular weight of parent compound
fields.name: mw_freebase

fields.info: Calculated ALogP
fields.name: alogp

fields.info: Number hydrogen bond acceptors
fields.name: hba

fields.info: Number hydrogen bond donors
fields.name: hbd

fields.info: Polar surface area
fields.name: psa

fields.info: Number rotatable bonds
fields.name: rtb

fields.info: Indicates whether the compound passes the rule-of-three (mw < 300, logP < 3 etc)
fields.name: ro3_pass

fields.info: Number of violations of Lipinski's rule-of-five, using HBA and HBD definitions
fields.name: num_ro5_violations

fields.info: DEPRECATED. Replaced by new structural alerts tables. Will be removed in future releases.
fields.name: med_chem_friendly

fields.info: The most acidic pKa calculated using ACDlabs v12.01
fields.name: acd_most_apka

fields.info: The most basic pKa calculated using ACDlabs v12.01
fields.name: acd_most_bpka

fields.info: The calculated octanol/water partition coefficient using ACDlabs v12.01
fields.name: acd_logp

fields.info: The calculated octanol/water distribution coefficient at pH7.4 using ACDlabs v12.01
fields.name: acd_logd

fields.info: Indicates whether the compound is an acid/base/neutral
fields.name: molecular_species

fields.info: Molecular weight of the full compound including any salts
fields.name: full_mwt

fields.info: Number of aromatic rings
fields.name: aromatic_rings

fields.info: Number of heavy (non-hydrogen) atoms
fields.name: heavy_atoms

fields.info: Number of structural alerts used for QED calculation (as defined by Brenk et al., ChemMedChem 2008)
fields.name: num_alerts

fields.info: Weighted quantitative estimate of drug likeness (as defined by Bickerton et al., Nature Chem 2012)
fields.name: qed_weighted

fields.info: Monoisotopic parent molecular weight
fields.name: mw_monoisotopic

fields.info: Molecular formula for the full compound (including any salt)
fields.name: full_molformula

fields.info: Number of hydrogen bond acceptors calculated according to Lipinski's original rules (i.e., N + O count))
fields.name: hba_lipinski

fields.info: Number of hydrogen bond donors calculated according to Lipinski's original rules (i.e., NH + OH count)
fields.name: hbd_lipinski

fields.info: Number of violations of Lipinski's rule of five using HBA_LIPINSKI and HBD_LIPINSKI counts
fields.name: num_lipinski_ro5_violations

fields.info: Unique ID for a compound/record
fields.name: record_id (PK)

fields.info: Foreign key to compounds table (compound structure)
fields.name: molregno

fields.info: Foreign key to documents table
fields.name: doc

fields.info: Key text identifying this compound in the scientific document
fields.name: compound_key

fields.info: Name of this compound recorded in the scientific document
fields.name: compound_name

fields.info: Foreign key to source table
fields.name: src

fields.info: Identifier for the compound in the source database (e.g., pubchem SID)
fields.name: src_compound_id

fields.info: Primary key.
fields.name: cpd_str_alert_id (PK)

fields.info: Foreign key to the molecule_dictionary. The compound for which the structural alert has been found.
fields.name: molregno

fields.info: Foreign key to the structural_alerts table. The particular alert that has been identified in this compound.
fields.name: alert

fields.info: Internal Primary Key for the compound structure and foreign key to molecule_dictionary table
fields.name: molregno (PK)

fields.info: MDL Connection table representation of compound
fields.name: molfile

fields.info: IUPAC standard InChI for the compound
fields.name: standard_inchi

fields.info: IUPAC standard InChI key for the compound
fields.name: standard_inchi_key

fields.info: Canonical smiles, generated using pipeline pilot
fields.name: canonical_smiles

fields.info: 0-9 score showing level of confidence in assignment of the precise molecular target of the assay

fields.info: Description of the target types assigned with each score

fields.info: Short description of the target types assigned with each score

fields.info: Short description of the level of curation
fields.name: curated_by (PK)

fields.info: Definition of terms in the curated_by field.
fields.name: description

fields.info: Primary key. Short description of various types of errors/warnings applied to values in the activities table.
fields.name: data_validity_comment (PK)

fields.info: Definition of the terms in the data_validity_comment field.
fields.name: description

fields.info: ATC code for the compound (foreign key to ATC_CLASSIFICATION table)
fields.name: atc_code

fields.info: Value of defined daily dose
fields.name: ddd_value

fields.info: Units of defined daily dose
fields.name: ddd_units

fields.info: Administration route for dose
fields.name: ddd_admr

fields.info: Comment
fields.name: ddd_comment

fields.info: Internal primary key
fields.name: ddd_id (PK)

fields.info: Unique ID for the document
fields.name: doc_id (PK)

fields.info: Abbreviated journal name for an article
fields.name: journal

fields.info: Year of journal article publication
fields.name: year

fields.info: Volume of journal article
fields.name: volume

fields.info: Issue of journal article
fields.name: issue

fields.info: First page number of journal article
fields.name: first_page

fields.info: Last page number of journal article
fields.name: last_page

fields.info: NIH pubmed record ID, where available
fields.name: pubmed_id

fields.info: Digital object identifier for this reference
fields.name: doi

fields.info: ChEMBL identifier for this document (for use on web interface etc)
fields.name: chembl

fields.info: Document title (e.g., Publication title or description of dataset)
fields.name: title

fields.info: Type of the document (e.g., Publication, Deposited dataset)
fields.name: doc_type

fields.info: For a deposited dataset, the authors carrying out the screening and/or submitting the dataset.
fields.name: authors

fields.info: For a deposited dataset, a brief description of the dataset.
fields.name: abstract

fields.info: Primary key. Unique identifier for each domain.
fields.name: domain_id (PK)

fields.info: Indicates the source of the domain (e.g., Pfam).
fields.name: domain_type

fields.info: Identifier for the domain in the source database (e.g., Pfam ID such as PF00001).
fields.name: source_domain_id

fields.info: Name given to the domain in the source database (e.g., 7tm_1).
fields.name: domain_name

fields.info: Longer name or description for the domain.
fields.name: domain_description

fields.info: Primary key for each drug mechanism of action
fields.name: mec_id (PK)

fields.info: Record_id for the drug (foreign key to compound_records table)
fields.name: record

fields.info: Molregno for the drug (foreign key to molecule_dictionary table)
fields.name: molregno

fields.info: Description of the mechanism of action e.g., 'Phosphodiesterase 5 inhibitor'
fields.name: mechanism_of_action

fields.info: Target associated with this mechanism of action (foreign key to target_dictionary table)

fields.info: Binding site for the drug within the target (where known) - foreign key to binding_sites table
fields.name: site

fields.info: Type of action of the drug on the target e.g., agonist/antagonist etc (foreign key to action_type table)
fields.name: action_type

fields.info: Flag to show whether the molecule is believed to interact directly with the target (1 = yes, 0 = no)

fields.info: Flag to show whether the mechanism of action describes the molecular target of the drug, rather than a higher-level physiological mechanism e.g., vasodilator (1 = yes, 0 = no)
fields.name: molecular_mechanism

fields.info: Flag to show whether the target assigned is believed to play a role in the efficacy of the drug in the indication(s) for which it is approved (1 = yes, 0 = no)
fields.name: disease_efficacy

fields.info: Additional comments regarding the mechanism of action
fields.name: mechanism_comment

fields.info: Additional comments regarding the selectivity of the drug
fields.name: selectivity_comment

fields.info: Additional comments regarding the binding site of the drug
fields.name: binding_site_comment

fields.info: Foreign key to drug_mechanism table - indicating the mechanism to which the references refer

fields.info: Indicates that a drug has a therapeutic application (as opposed to e.g., an imaging agent, additive etc).

fields.info: Type of molecule (Small molecule, Protein, Antibody, Oligosaccharide, Oligonucleotide, Cell, Unknown)

fields.info: Earliest known approval year for the molecule

fields.info: Indicates whether the drug is known to be administered orally.

fields.info: Indicates whether the drug is known to be administered parenterally
fields.name: parenteral

fields.info: Indicates whether the drug is known to be administered topically.
fields.name: topical

fields.info: Indicates that the drug has a black box warning
fields.name: black_box_warning

fields.info: Indicates whether the compound is natural product-derived (currently curated only for drugs)
fields.name: natural_product

fields.info: Indicates whether this is known to be the first compound of its class (e.g., acting on a particular target).
fields.name: first_in_class

fields.info: Shows whether a drug is dosed as a racemic mixture (0), single stereoisomer (1) or is an achiral molecule (2)
fields.name: chirality

fields.info: Indicates that the molecule is a pro-drug (see molecule hierarchy for active component, where known)
fields.name: prodrug

fields.info: Indicates whether the molecule is inorganic (i.e., containing only metal atoms and <2 carbon atoms)
fields.name: inorganic_flag

fields.info: The year in which the application for a USAN/INN name was made
fields.name: usan_year

fields.info: The availability type for the drug (0 = discontinued, 1 = prescription only, 2 = over the counter)
fields.name: availability_type

fields.info: Where the compound has been assigned a USAN name, this indicates the stem, as described in the USAN_STEM table.
fields.name: usan_stem

fields.info: Indicates whether a molecule is a small molecule polymer (e.g., polistyrex)
fields.name: polymer_flag

fields.info: Where the compound has been assigned a USAN name, this indicates the substem
fields.name: usan_substem

fields.info: Definition of the USAN stem
fields.name: usan_stem_definition

fields.info: Indication class(es) assigned to a drug in the USP dictionary
fields.name: indication_class

fields.info: Primary key.
fields.name: mol_frac_id (PK)

fields.info: Foreign key to frac_classification table showing the mechanism of action classification of the compound.
fields.name: frac_class

fields.info: Foreign key to molecule_dictionary, showing the compound to which the classification applies.
fields.name: molregno

fields.info: Foreign key to compounds table. This field holds a list of all of the ChEMBL compounds with associated data (e.g., activity information, approved drugs). Parent compounds that are generated only by removing salts, and which do not themselves have any associated data will not appear here.
fields.name: molregno (PK)

fields.info: Represents parent compound of molregno in first field (i.e., generated by removing salts). Where molregno and parent_molregno are same, the initial ChEMBL compound did not contain a salt component, or else could not be further processed for various reasons (e.g., inorganic mixture). Compounds which are only generated by removing salts will appear in this field only. Those which, themselves, have any associated data (e.g., activity data) or are launched drugs will also appear in the molregno field.
fields.name: parent_molregno

fields.info: Where a compound is a pro-drug, this represents the active metabolite of the 'dosed' compound given by parent_molregno. Where parent_molregno and active_molregno are the same, the compound is not currently known to be a pro-drug.
fields.name: active_molregno

fields.info: Primary key
fields.name: mol_hrac_id (PK)

fields.info: Foreign key to hrac_classification table showing the classification for the compound.
fields.name: hrac_class

fields.info: Foreign key to molecule_dictionary, showing the compound to which this classification applies.
fields.name: molregno

fields.info: Primary key.
fields.name: mol_irac_id (PK)

fields.info: Foreign key to the irac_classification table showing the mechanism of action classification for the compound.
fields.name: irac_class

fields.info: Foreign key to the molecule_dictionary table, showing the compound to which the classification applies.
fields.name: molregno

fields.info: Foreign key to molecule_dictionary
fields.name: molregno

fields.info: Type of name/synonym (e.g., TRADE_NAME, RESEARCH_CODE, USAN)
fields.name: syn_type

fields.info: Primary key.
fields.name: molsyn_id (PK)

fields.info: Foreign key to the research_stem table. Where a synonym is a research code, this links to further information about the company associated with that code.
fields.name: res_stem

fields.info: Synonym for the compound
fields.name: synonyms

fields.info: Internal primary key
fields.name: oc_id (PK)

fields.info: NCBI taxonomy ID for the organism (corresponding to tax_ids in assay2target and target_dictionary tables)
fields.name: tax_id

fields.info: Highest level classification (e.g., Eukaryotes, Bacteria, Fungi etc)
fields.name: l1

fields.info: Second level classification
fields.name: l2

fields.info: Third level classification
fields.name: l3

fields.info: Short name for the type of parameter associated with an assay
fields.name: parameter_type (PK)

fields.info: Description of the parameter type
fields.name: description

fields.info: Primary key. Patent use code from FDA Orange Book
fields.name: patent_use_code (PK)

fields.info: Definition for the patent use code, from FDA Orange Book.
fields.name: definition

fields.info: Primary key.
fields.name: predbind_id (PK)

fields.info: Foreign key to the activities table, indicating the compound/assay(+target) combination for which this prediction is made.
fields.name: activity

fields.info: Foreign key to the binding_sites table, indicating the binding site (domain) that the compound is predicted to bind to.
fields.name: site

fields.info: The method used to assign the binding domain (e.g., 'Single domain' where the protein has only 1 domain, 'Multi domain' where the protein has multiple domains, but only 1 is known to bind small molecules in other proteins).
fields.name: prediction_method

fields.info: The level of confidence assigned to the prediction (high where the protein has only 1 domain, medium where the compound has multiple domains, but only 1 known small molecule-binding domain).
fields.name: confidence

fields.info: Primary key
fields.name: prod_pat_id (PK)

fields.info: Foreign key to products table - FDA application number for the product
fields.name: product

fields.info: Patent numbers as submitted by the applicant holder for patents covered by the statutory provisions
fields.name: patent_no

fields.info: Date the patent expires as submitted by the applicant holder including applicable extensions
fields.name: patent_expire_date

fields.info: Patents submitted on FDA Form 3542 and listed after August 18, 2003 may have a drug substance flag set to 1, indicating the sponsor submitted the patent as claiming the drug substance
fields.name: drug_substance_flag

fields.info: Patents submitted on FDA Form 3542 and listed after August 18, 2003 may have a drug product flag set to 1, indicating the sponsor submitted the patent as claiming the drug product
fields.name: drug_product_flag

fields.info: Code to designate a use patent that covers the approved indication or use of a drug product
fields.name: patent_use_code

fields.info: Sponsor has requested patent be delisted if set to 1.  This patent has remained listed because, under Section 505(j)(5)(D)(i) of the Act, a first applicant may retain eligibility for 180-day exclusivity based on a paragraph IV certification to this patent for a certain period.  Applicants under Section 505(b)(2) are not required to certify to patents where this flag is set to 1
fields.name: delist_flag

fields.info: The dosage form of the product (e.g., tablet, capsule etc)
fields.name: dosage_form

fields.info: The administration route of the product (e.g., oral, injection etc)
fields.name: route

fields.info: The trade name for the product
fields.name: trade_name

fields.info: The FDA approval date for the product (not necessarily first approval of the active ingredient)
fields.name: approval_date

fields.info: RX = prescription, OTC = over the counter, DISCN = discontinued
fields.name: ad_type

fields.info: Flag to show whether product is orally delivered
fields.name: oral

fields.info: Flag to show whether product is topically delivered
fields.name: topical

fields.info: Flag to show whether product is parenterally delivered
fields.name: parenteral

fields.info: Flag to show whether the product label has a black box warning
fields.name: black_box_warning

fields.info: Name of the company applying for FDA approval
fields.name: applicant_full_name

fields.info: Flag to show whether the applicant is the innovator of the product
fields.name: innovator_company

fields.info: FDA application number for the product
fields.name: product_id (PK)

fields.info: New Drug Application Type. The type of new drug application approval.  New Drug Applications (NDA or innovator)  are "N".   Abbreviated New Drug Applications (ANDA or generic) are "A".
fields.name: nda_type

fields.info: Primary key.
fields.name: protclasssyn_id (PK)

fields.info: Foreign key to the PROTEIN_CLASSIFICATION table. The protein_class to which this synonym applies.
fields.name: protein_class

fields.info: The synonym for the protein class.
fields.name: protein_class_synonym

fields.info: The type or origin of the synonym (e.g., ChEMBL, Concept Wiki, UMLS).
fields.name: syn_type

fields.info: Primary key. Unique identifier for each protein family classification.
fields.name: protein_class_id (PK)

fields.info: Protein_class_id for the parent of this protein family.
fields.name: parent_id

fields.info: Preferred/full name for this protein family.
fields.name: pref_name

fields.info: Short/abbreviated name for this protein family (not necessarily unique).
fields.name: short_name

fields.info: Concatenated description of each classification for searching purposes etc.
fields.name: protein_class_desc

fields.info: Definition of the protein family.
fields.name: definition

fields.info: Level of the class within the hierarchy (level 1 = top level classification)
fields.name: class_level

fields.info: Primary key. Unique identifier for each classification.
fields.name: protein_class_id (PK)

fields.info: Concatenated description of each classification for searching purposes etc.
fields.name: protein_class_desc

fields.info: First level classification (e.g., Enzyme, Transporter, Ion Channel).
fields.name: l1

fields.info: Second level classification.
fields.name: l2

fields.info: Third level classification.
fields.name: l3

fields.info: Fourth level classification.
fields.name: l4

fields.info: Fifth level classification.
fields.name: l5

fields.info: Sixth level classification.
fields.name: l6

fields.info: Seventh level classification.
fields.name: l7

fields.info: Eighth level classification.
fields.name: l8

fields.info: Relationship_type flag used in the assay2target table
fields.name: relationship_type (PK)

fields.info: Description of relationship_type flags
fields.name: relationship_desc

fields.info: Primary key.
fields.name: co_stem_id (PK)

fields.info: Foreign key to research_stem table.
fields.name: res_stem

fields.info: Name of current company associated with this research code stem.
fields.name: company

fields.info: Country in which the company uses this research code stem.
fields.name: country

fields.info: Previous name of the company associated with this research code stem (e.g., if the company has undergone acquisitions/mergers).
fields.name: previous_company

fields.info: Primary key. Unique ID for each research code stem.
fields.name: res_stem_id (PK)

fields.info: The actual stem/prefix used in the research code.
fields.name: research_stem

fields.info: Primary key.
fields.name: sitecomp_id (PK)

fields.info: Foreign key to binding_sites table.
fields.name: site

fields.info: Foreign key to the component_sequences table, indicating which molecular component of the target is involved in the binding site.
fields.name: component

fields.info: Foreign key to the domains table, indicating which domain of the given molecular component is involved in the binding site (where not known, the domain_id may be null).
fields.name: domain

fields.info: List of residues from the given molecular component that make up the binding site (where not know, will be null).
fields.name: site_residues

fields.info: Identifier for each source (used in compound_records and assays tables)
fields.name: src_id (PK)

fields.info: Description of the data source
fields.name: src_description

fields.info: A short name for each data source, for display purposes
fields.name: src_short_name

fields.info: Unique ID for the structural alert set
fields.name: alert_set_id (PK)

fields.info: Name (or origin) of the structural alert set
fields.name: set_name

fields.info: Priority assigned to the structural alert set for display on the ChEMBL interface (priorities >=4 are shown by default).
fields.name: priority

fields.info: Primary key. Unique identifier for the structural alert
fields.name: alert_id (PK)

fields.info: Foreign key to structural_alert_sets table indicating which set this particular alert comes from
fields.name: alert_set

fields.info: A name for the structural alert
fields.name: alert_name

fields.info: SMARTS defining the structural feature that is considered to be an alert
fields.name: smarts

fields.info: Foreign key to the target_dictionary, indicating the target to which the components belong.
fields.name: tid

fields.info: Foreign key to the component_sequences table, indicating which components belong to the target.
fields.name: component

fields.info: Primary key.
fields.name: targcomp_id (PK)

fields.info: Indicates that the given component is a homologue of the correct component (e.g., from a different species) when set to 1. This may be the case if the sequence for the correct protein/nucleic acid cannot be found in sequence databases. A value of 2 indicates that the sequence given is a representative of a species group, e.g., an E. coli protein to represent the target of a broad-spectrum antibiotic.
fields.name: homologue

fields.info: Unique ID for the target
fields.name: tid (PK)

fields.info: Describes whether target is a protein, an organism, a tissue etc. Foreign key to TARGET_TYPE table.
fields.name: target_type

fields.info: Preferred target name: manually curated
fields.name: pref_name

fields.info: NCBI taxonomy id of target
fields.name: tax_id

fields.info: Source organism of molecuar target or tissue, or the target organism if compound activity is reported in an organism rather than a protein or tissue
fields.name: organism

fields.info: ChEMBL identifier for this target (for use on web interface etc)
fields.name: chembl

fields.info: Flag to indicate whether the target represents a group of species, rather than an individual species (e.g., 'Bacterial DHFR'). Where set to 1, indicates that any associated target components will be a representative, rather than a comprehensive set.
fields.name: species_group_flag

fields.info: Identifier for target of interest (foreign key to target_dictionary table)
fields.name: tid

fields.info: Relationship between two targets (e.g., SUBSET OF, SUPERSET OF, OVERLAPS WITH)
fields.name: relationship

fields.info: Identifier for the target that is related to the target of interest (foreign key to target_dicitionary table)
fields.name: related_tid

fields.info: Primary key
fields.name: targrel_id (PK)

fields.info: Target type (as used in target dictionary)
fields.name: target_type (PK)

fields.info: Description of target type
fields.name: target_desc

fields.info: Higher level classification of target_type, allowing grouping of e.g., all 'PROTEIN' targets, all 'NON-MOLECULAR' targets etc.
fields.name: parent_type

fields.info: Numeric primary key.
fields.name: usan_stem_id (PK)

fields.info: Stem defined for use in United States Adopted Names.
fields.name: stem

fields.info: More specific subgroup of the stem defined for use in United States Adopted Names.
fields.name: subgroup

fields.info: Meaning of the stem (e.g., the class of compound it applies to).
fields.name: annotation

fields.info: Indicates whether stem is used as a Prefix/Infix/Suffix.
fields.name: stem_class

fields.info: Protein family targeted by compounds of this class (e.g., GPCR/Ion channel/Protease) where known/applicable.
fields.name: major_class

fields.info: Stem not represented in USAN list, but added from WHO INN stem list (where set to 1).
fields.name: who_extra

fields.info: Name of release version
fields.name: name (PK)

fields.info: Date database created
fields.name: creation_date

fields.info: Description of release version
fields.name: comments
